description.narrative: 1. Project: 12007 Education Quality Enhancement Initiative (EQEI)#2. Project area and Country: Mubende District, Uganda.#3. Project justification: #According to the District Development Plan 2016 2020, low quality of education is one of the most pressing development challenges in Uganda. Moreover, surveys have shown that pupils attending public schools especially in rural areas cannot read or solve simple arithmetic calculations.#Low teacher proficiency greatly contributes to low quality of teaching. Furth ermore, teacher absenteeism discourages parents from sending their children to school, thus contributing to high pupil absenteeism and dropout rates. Many parents also prioritize domestic work, market days and agricultural activities, while school related gender-based violence (SRGBV) has great impact in particular on girls school attendance. #4. The main objective and expected results:#The overall objective of the project is to improve the learning outcomes of the girls and boys in the 20-targeted primary schools. This will be accomplished through teachers improved teaching skills and appropriate methodologies in early grade reading and mathematics, strengthened school management and support to the School Management Committees (SMCs) and Parent-Teacher Asso ciations (PTAs). Furthermore, the project will promote active community and parent participation in the education of their children. #As a result, the learners in the targeted primary schools are expected to have enhanced literacy and numeracy skills. The schools will have improved student retention rates, higher teacher proficiency and functional school management committees. The general perception of schools as safe learning environments will have improved. 5. Right-holders/ beneficiaries: 12,500 learne rs. #Duty bearers: 160 teachers, 2080 parents/guardians, 180 management committees (SMCs), and 11 district staffs.#6. Implementing partner: Rural Action Community Based Organization (RABOCAO).
